title: [DOC-FIX] mlflow ui results with 404  when running the tutorial

labels.name: needs author feedback
labels.description: Issue is waiting for the author to respond

body:
Hi,
This is regarding the documentation of the [tutorial](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/tutorial.html) 

### running the mlflow ui  results with 404
When following the tutorial documentation it seems that the relative path when running the first part of the tutorial is the root of the cloned [github repo](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow).
Thus running the example requires running with the parent directory to the example(** examples/sklearn_elasticnet_wine/**):  
` python examples/sklearn_elasticnet_wine/train.py`  

However when running the `mlflow ui` (after running the train several times -  I can see the results in the folder `mlruns/0/` ) from the same directory  I get an *404 error NOT FOUND* 

moving to the root project `cd examples/sklearn_elasticnet_wine/` and then running `mlflow ui` the site successfully load **BUT** the `Artifact Location./mlruns/0` (obviously since the runs are saved in the parent folder.). 

After running running the `python train.py` from within the folder `examples/sklearn_elasticnet_wine` the runs are save under the local mlruns and thus are able to be seen from the `ui`

1. please clarify this issue (including using the `--default-artifact-root`)
2. running in an offline environment I can see that it is looking for `maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com`  - is there a way to disable any external calls from the `ui`?
3. BTW the table output for the ui from the current master git is different from the screenshots in the documentations (e.g. it has the `metrics` columns as one whereas in the tutorial documentation it is split out into 3)
